diagrams.description: A timeline showing the history of Telecommunications Engineering.
diagrams.mermaid_code:
timeline
    title The History of Telecommunications Engineering
    section 19th Century: The Telegraph and Telephone
        1837 : Samuel Morse patents the telegraph
        1876 : Alexander Graham Bell patents the telephone
        1895 : Guglielmo Marconi - Wireless telegraphy
    section Early 20th Century: Radio and Television
        1901 : First transatlantic radio transmission
        1920s : AM radio broadcasting begins
        1930s : FM radio is developed
        1936 : The first public television broadcasts
    section Mid-20th Century: The Digital Revolution
        1947 : The transistor is invented
        1948 : Claude Shannon's "A Mathematical Theory of Communication"
        1962 : The first communications satellite, Telstar 1
    section Late 20th Century: The Internet and Mobile
        1973 : The first handheld mobile phone call
        1983 : The Internet is created
        1990s : The World Wide Web
    section 21st Century: The Wireless and Broadband Era
        2000s : The rise of broadband and VoIP
        2010s : The proliferation of smartphones and 4G/LTE
        2020s : The rollout of 5G
